div.div: We need to checksum to trigger an update on secret-change

div.div: Client discovers the secret-manager automatically and per convention

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 338px; height: 1px; padding-top: 485px; margin-left: 32px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font: The JWT of the SA is mounted into the FS of the pod as volume. The minimum TTL is 10min. Notice the custom audience for the secret-manager. This prevents misuse of this token.

font.span: This FS cannot be read from anybody (no shell). Therefore, we are allowed to use a long-lived token (<1y or EOF of pod)

switch.text: The JWT of the SA is mounted into the FS of the pod as v...

div.div: The client-lib used in the service reads the SA-JWT from the FS and sends it as the Auth-header to the Secret-Manager.
The Secret-Manager then validates the JWT and checks if the service has access.

switch.text: The client-lib used in the service reads the SA-JWT from...

div.div: This format depends on the used backend but follows the same pattern.

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
